title: A Car That Turns (by Amirali Rajan)
author: Anotherkellydown
siteName: TouchArcade - iPhone, iPad, Android Games Forum
text: Staff Member Patreon Bronze Link: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/a-car-that-turns/id1604282227 A Car That Turns No ads. No tracking. No IAP. Just game. Crazy right? Built with love by an indie game dev. You have a car. It can tu… DetailsNo ads. No tracking. No IAP. Just game. Crazy right? Built with love by an indie game dev. You have a car. It can turn. Hell. It even drifts. Which is a good thing. Why is drifting a good thing you may ask? Because it's the only way you'll survive Akina Pass. Actually... you probably won't make it past the first corner. TouchArcade Rating:Unrated Compatibility:HD Universal Staff Member Patreon Bronze I’m interested to hear some impressions, as this doesn’t look like much. But it’s by the dev behind A Dark Room and A Noble Circle so there may be more here than the screenshots can convey. I did get this in view of the dev’s pedigree and his challenge in the description...”you probably won’t make it past the first corner”…which was correct; so the title is somewhat misleading. It should be called ‘A Car That Doesn’t Turn’. Steering and drifting controls are hyper-sensitive and very difficult, which I guess is the whole point. However, if you like to do six impossible things before breakfast it’s a great place to start. I think what makes A Car That Turns (sic) compulsive is the speed of reloading. Every crash prompts an instant reload and continue from the last checkpoint - zero waiting time reduces the frustration of inevitable failure. Spolier - eventually made it round the first corner resulting in much merriment. It‘s not "by the dev behind A Dark Room", it‘s by the dev who ported Michael Townsend‘s A Dark Room to iOS. And I think it shows in all following releases. He‘s getting a little too much credit in my eyes. Actually completed a whole lap! Never thought that would happen. Took 528.03 seconds and about 50 saves and restarts. Not so bad once I got the drift. Turn into corners early, especially hairpins. Feeling a great sense of achievement. Glad you stuck with it and made it to the end of Akina. I've got a new track in the works which will hopefully release in a few weeks. Share This Page
